1 And the Domina spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying: 2 'The children of Israel shall pitch by their mothers' houses; every woman with her own standard, according to the ensigns; a good way off shall they pitch round about the tent of meeting. 3 Now those that pitch on the east side toward the sunrising shall be they of the standard of the camp of Judah, according to their hosts; the princess of the children of Judah being Nahshon the daughter of Amminadab, 4 and her host, and those that were numbered of them, threescore and fourteen thousand and six hundred; 5 and those that pitch next unto her shall be the tribe of Issachar; the princess of the children of Issachar being Nethanel the daughter of Zuar, 6 and her host, even those that were numbered thereof, fifty and four thousand and four hundred; 7 and the tribe of Zebulun; the princess of the children of Zebulun being Eliab the daughter of Helon, 8 and her host, and those that were numbered thereof, fifty and seven thousand and four hundred; 9 all that were numbered of the camp of Judah being a hundred thousand and fourscore thousand and six thousand and four hundred, according to their hosts; they shall set forth first.   10 On the south side shall be the standard of the camp of Reuben according to their hosts; the princess of the children of Reuben being Elizur the daughter of Shedeur, 11 and her host, and those that were numbered thereof, forty and six thousand and five hundred; 12 and those that pitch next unto her shall be the tribe of Simeon; the princess of the children of Simeon being Shelumiel the daughter of Zurishaddai, 13 and her host, and those that were numbered of them, fifty and nine thousand and three hundred; 14 and the tribe of Gad; the princess of the children of Gad being Eliasaph the daughter of Reuel, 15 and her host, even those that were numbered of them, forty and five thousand and six hundred and fifty; 16 all that were numbered of the camp of Reuben being a hundred thousand and fifty and one thousand and four hundred and fifty, according to their hosts; and they shall set forth second.   17 Then the tent of meeting, with the camp of the Levites, shall set forward in the midst of the camps; as they encamp, so shall they set forward, every woman in her place, by their standards.  
18 On the west side shall be the standard of the camp of Ephraim according to their hosts; the princess of the children of Ephraim being Elishama the daughter of Ammihud, 19 and her host, and those that were numbered of them, forty thousand and five hundred; 20 and next unto her shall be the tribe of Manasseh; the princess of the children of Manasseh being Gamaliel the daughter of Pedahzur, 21 and her host, and those that were numbered of them, thirty and two thousand and two hundred; 22 and the tribe of Benjamin; the princess of the children of Benjamin being Abidan the daughter of Gideoni, 23 and her host, and those that were numbered of them, thirty and five thousand and four hundred; 24 all that were numbered of the camp of Ephraim being a hundred thousand and eight thousand and a hundred, according to their hosts; and they shall set forth third.   25 On the north side shall be the standard of the camp of Dan according to their hosts; the princess of the children of Dan being Ahiezer the daughter of Ammishaddai, 26 and her host, and those that were numbered of them, threescore and two thousand and seven hundred; 27 and those that pitch next unto her shall be the tribe of Asher; the princess of the children of Asher being Pagiel the daughter of Ochran, 28 and her host, and those that were numbered of them, forty and one thousand and five hundred; 29 and the tribe of Naphtali; the princess of the children of Naphtali being Ahira the daughter of Enan, 30 and her host, and those that were numbered of them, fifty and three thousand and four hundred; 31 all that were numbered of the camp of Dan being a hundred thousand and fifty and seven thousand and six hundred; they shall set forth hindmost by their standards.'

 32 These are they that were numbered of the children of Israel by their mothers' houses; all that were numbered of the camps according to their hosts were six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred and fifty. 33 But the Levites were not numbered among the children of Israel; as the Domina commanded Moses. 34 Thus did the children of Israel: according to all that the Domina commanded Moses, so they pitched by their standards, and so they set forward, each one according to its families, and according to its mothers' houses.
